hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1458 aan today's date is
December 27th 2017 and the top of the
episode is the central bank's position
themselves to transition the world into
their new system let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now we
can see the corporate media they are out
there and MasterCard you know release
their press release on how much people
have spent over this holiday season
we're gonna get into that in just a
moment but what's very interesting is
that consumer confidence pretty much
stumbles as hope plunges and what we're
seeing is there's a huge spread now the
spread that we're seeing this is the
widest spread between current and future
expectations in history and every time
we've seen this type of spread what has
happened well if we go back to 2008 we
saw the same thing where the current and
future expectations there is a huge
spread and basically we entered a
recession if we go back to 2001 we see
the same thing if we go back in time
it's pretty much the same thing and here
we are once again with that same exact
spread and this is just another
indicator letting us know that something
isn't right now we know the retail
industry they've been struggling a lot
of stores are closing and the corporate
media is out there telling us that this
is a one of the best holiday seasons
that we've seen in a long time in
MasterCard they released their press
release with some data on how much
remember debt people have used to
purchase items now this press release
came from MasterCard spending plus and
it reported the holiday shopping and it
it didn't include automotive and it
didn't include gasoline sales so from
November 1st through December 24th
across all payment types cash check
everything else we see that they're
saying that retail is or spending I
should say rose to four point nine
percent from the same period a year ago
now it makes it seem like it moved up
another four point nine percent and it's
doing great that's not what happened if
you go back a year ago 2016 the spending
at that time was four percent so we went
up point nine percent that part is a
little misleading now remember we were
at four point nine percent and store I
mean a four percent back in twenty
sixteen and stores were closing they
couldn't make it here we are at four
point nine percent and again this is
what people spent using debt this is not
the profits of the stores these are two
different things because what's included
in this is people going out to dinner
people buying a lot of food for the
holidays Thanksgiving Christmas and
everything else this is everyday
shopping this is not just one thing so
this is a lot of different things all
wrapped up to one and a lot of people
use their credit cards to pay their
bills
so we need to look at this very very
carefully and if we go back to 2016 like
I said retail sales grew at four percent
in 2016 this is coming from the same
type of press release that Marsten
MasterCard spending pulse puts out there
if we go back to 2015 they released the
same numbers and it was 7.9 percent in
2015 in 2014 it was 5.5 percent so we
went from 5.5 percent and all of a
sudden we went the 7.9 percent which
again which means nothing this is just
debt and then all of a sudden dropped to
four and we're four point nine percent
so we're have we really gone is this
really that great of a holiday season
because we're hovering around that four
percent now let's go a little bit
further here online sales went up to 18
percent year-over-year now they're
making it seem like oh my god is that 18
percent but it was at 15.6 percent last
year
so it wasn't like it doubled it tripled
or anything like that more people
decided I'm gonna sit at home and I'm
gonna order online no this is not all
Amazon so we need to look at this data
and we need to say well wait a minute
what are they really doing here what
really makes sense now what's very
interesting is that if you remove the
gasoline sales from their number four
point nine percent sales went up by four
point two percent is it as great as
they're saying right now no it's not so
what is happening here is they're using
four point nine percent to make everyone
believe that sales increased by four
point nine percent sales didn't increase
debt increased we don't know what the
holiday season is going to look like
until the retailer's publish their
numbers and what profit and that's the
bottom line
what's their revenue because yeah this
is a great number four point nine
percent we're really isn't but four
point nine percent but if they didn't
make any profit they're gonna be closing
down and if we look at this we could see
that there's major problems here now
coming out of op toro they look at the
holiday season they say okay we see the
holiday season and we're going to give
you an estimate of the returns they're
saying that consumers are going to be
going to be returning about forty-five
percent of their purchases and it's
gonna be about ninety billion worth of
goods so we're gonna have to subtract
that number when the returns start
coming in and most of the returns guess
what they end up with and landfills a
lot of it they don't even restock on the
shelves they go back to the
manufacturers it might be damaged
something else might be wrong and we can
see right now this is going to be a
problem now UPS is out there and they're
saying that they're looking at a huge
return extravaganza in January of 2018
they said listen
last January 2017 5.8 million packages
were returned to retailers and they're
saying that in January they're gonna
probably beat that number now when we
look at all this and even when we go
towards restaurants we can see that
restaurant sales they are down now look
at these numbers they were at 5.6
percent in 2016 they are on pace and
we're almost at the end of this year for
3.2 percent that's how far restaurant
sales are down which tells you we are in
a whole heap of trouble now remember a
lot of these purchases they are done on
debt and we can take a look at these
debt levels because the Urban Institute
was able to release figures on debt
levels across America and when we look
at the states we can see that Wow a lot
of these states the people that live in
these states there's a huge amount of
debt and we see right now statisti
reports nationwide 33 percent of people
have debt that has gone into collections
which means they have unpaid billed
creditors have either closed or trying
to collect now in Louisiana we see that
there's about 46 percent of the
population in Louisiana who are in debt
44 percent in Texas 43 percent in South
Carolina which I mean when I say they're
in debt
this is debt in collections West
Virginia 42 percent navona 41 percent
Alabama 40 percent Georgia 40 percent
Kentucky 40 percent Mississippi 40
percent New Mexico 40 percent we are a
debtor nation and we're gonna see a lot
of these numbers they're gonna be
revised and we're gonna get the real
information when the retailer's start to
produce their real profit revenue sales
numbers but we can see right now there
is a 20-18 Deathwatch of certain
retailers Clair stores well it looks
like they are on
a Deathwatch they're seeing that sales
they aren't doing too well and they're
very nervous about this holiday season
Charlotte ruh they are very nervous
about you know what is going to happen
this holiday season and they might be
closing stores Banton stores the same
thing happening with them by low Barnes
and Noble they're looking at this
holiday season saying they don't know if
they're gonna be able to make it they
might have to start closing some stores
we see that Nine West we know that they
declare bankruptcy in 2017 and it looks
like they might be closing a lot more
stores GNC was actually doing well and
then all of a sudden they are on the
Death Watch now saying that the S sales
are dropping right now and we might be
closing some stores and there's gonna be
a lot more stores they're gonna come out
and say yeah we're having problems here
and as we move forward
I think things are just gonna get worse
and worse and I think these numbers that
they're putting out there is trying to
convince everyone that this holiday
season was one of the best we've ever
seen of course they said this is one of
the best since 2011
well 2011 was we were coming into a
recession
I mean just go back a couple of years
this number that we have right now is
absolutely awful
this is not a good retail number and
again once the retailers come out and
they tell us what the real information
is we're gonna see that yeah this stores
not doing well we already have
restaurants like subway already saying
they're closing stores we're gonna have
stores that are just not going to be
able to make it and with this four point
not 9 percent debt number that
MasterCard is throwing out there it
doesn't look that good even though the
corporate media is trying to make it
seem like it's incredible now what's
very interesting is that the Fed is out
there and we mentioned this many times
before where they're saying that they're
not seeing any red flashing signals that
the market there's a problem they don't
see any indicators of financial
stability risks and again the Fed is
never going to let you know if there is
because people will panic and their job
is to hide that from
so they can bring down the economy and
steal your wealth they don't want people
to know what's really going on remember
they're not part of the government
they're a separate corporation they make
a profit all their information is hidden
from the public and they're running our
country our economic policies of this
country anyone see a problem with this
yes there is a major problem with this
but on December 5th the ofr released its
annual report for 2017 and it
contradicts everything that Yellen has
said and the report noted that there are
numerous areas where literally flashing
red and orange
you know signals are going off
everywhere and there the market risk is
in the red zone the report notes the
following market risks from a sharp
change in the prices of assets in
financial markets are high and rising
rising prices and fallen risk premiums
may leave some markets vulnerable to big
changes risk premiums are returns in
excess of returns on risk-free
investments such market Corrections can
trigger financial instability when the
assets are held by entities that I have
excessive leverage and rely on
short-term debt and other liabilities so
going forward what is happening here is
the Fed is trying to make it seem like
everything is fine and what we're really
seeing is that we have financial
instability all around us and we're
seeing red orange signals flashing
everywhere and I just wanted to mention
one other thing about retail we also
need to keep in mind that the debt is
coming due in 2018 so a lot of these
retailers are going to have to pay up
and with this four point nine percent
debt where people are spending debt this
is not money to actually have this is
going to be a problem because once we
get the real information from the real
to the retailers and we find out what
sales they have what their revenue is
what profits they made and how much they
owe on this debt well we're gonna see a
lot of problems happening now we
understand the crypto
it continually surges up that dropped a
little bit and keep moving up and like I
said before the crypto market is
incredible it's a decentralized system
in the hands of the people
it's a an incredible system same thing
with gold and silver in the hands of the
people keeping everything on the
up-and-up just like with cryptocurrency
it is an incredible system it's when the
central bankers get involved that's when
everything breaks down because they
don't like gold and silver they don't
like a decentralized system where the
people can they can control everything
and what they're pushing for is their
own type of coin in the crypto market
because they see what the crypto market
is now the Washington Post was pushing a
piece about the Fed coin they're saying
it doesn't exist yet but I think it's
waiting in the wings but one thing that
we do know that does exist already and
we talked about this before where UBS
being why Mellon deutsche bank Santander
and many other banks they've been
working on their own crypto coin and
this crypto coin is called utility
settlement coin sounds very familiar and
I mean it sounds like a familiar name I
should say and this is real they've been
developing this for quite a while right
now and the banks have been testing this
now the ultimate goal of this project is
to create a digital currency known as
utility settlement coin which will
facilitate payment and settlement for
institutional financial markets this is
what the official Deutsche Bank website
says about utility settlement coin USC
is an asset backed digital cash
instrument implemented on distributed
ledger technology for use within global
institutional financial markets USC is a
series of cash assets which with a
version for each of the major currencies
u.s. the dollar the euro and many others
and USC is
at parity with a bank deposit in the
corresponding currency USC is fully
backed by cash assets held at a central
bank spending AUSA will be spending its
paired real-world currency UBS and Clare
batiks launched the concept in 2015 to
validate the potential benefits of USC
for capital efficiency settlement and
systemic risk reduction in global
financial markets the project was
initially incubated as part of UBS
crypto 2.0 Pathfinder program
UBS is initiative for research and
experimentation on blockchain
now they're going to be pushing this out
because they're almost done testing it
and they're going to be trying to
position themselves to enter the
blockchain system with the USC and I
think what they're going to try to do is
they're gonna try to transition everyone
into this now is everyone going to go
willingly and say well let's go to the

of course not they're gonna stick with
Bitcoin bit cash - litecoin and any

problem is is if the central bank's push

they had each state vote on it and they
said yes all the states agreed and the
central bank was born in 1913 because
without that nobody was going to use the
Federal Reserve Note nobody really cared
about it the same thing here if they get
Congress and this is created into and
and made into law not just you now it's
but in other countries
everyone will have to use this yes you
probably could still use Bitcoin you can
still unless they decide to get rid of
them and I think this is why we're
seeing this surge in Bitcoin in a lot of
these crypto currencies because this is
how the central bank was play they like
to pump this up and they can buy a lot
of this with free money and then drop it
and say hey this is volatile it's not
safe look what we have we have the USC
and it just so happens we're pushing the

and this is why they've been in
manipulating gold and silver for a long

they set up a futures contract for
Bitcoin because they're trying to
control it all and shift everyone away
into their new system and I do believe
their new system is going to be made up
of many different things I think in a
high-level countries will be trading
maybe the petrol you want and using that
and at a lower level they're gonna want
everyone to use the cryptocurrency
because this will be a cashless society
but they want everyone to use theirs and
I think this is what they're gonna try
to push for I think this is what they're
trying to position themselves in in the
blockchain technology I think they're
trying to transition everyone into this
and I think this is the play they're
going to try to make and I'm not saying

thing the problem is is when central
bankers get involved I love gold and
silver the problem is is when central
bankers get involved if we remove

fantastic actually any system would be

you can see right now we are headed into

transitioning the economy I know they're

thousands of people and once again we

they manipulate it so what we're seeing

everything is great the central bank has

transfer it over to someplace else and

and I think this is their play I think

but they will figure out a way they will
try they will push their agenda because

it's not about ooh who's the wealthiest
